title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 201.6 - Hearing officers; assignment of hearings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 201.6 - Hearing officers; assignment of hearings

State Regulations

The hearing shall be conducted by a hearing officer appointed by the Attorney

General or his designee. Hearings shall be assigned to a particular hearing officer by the Attorney General or his designee. The hearing officer
shall be an attorney who has not worked on or otherwise become familiar with the facts of the matter in issue, and shall exercise his or her judgment
independently and impartially. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
201.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
